channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-5924] Tasks for 10.8.3 maintenance release
item.description:
Tracking issue for commits, etc for the 10.8.3 release
Release wiki will be at:
http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/DerbyTenEightThreeRelease

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: First patch for release to bump version and finalize release notes.

I had a quick look, and it looks good.
Except, I noticed in the diff that the copyright on the 10.8 branch still seems to be 2011, I wonder if that needs to be updated?
Looks like this was already done for the docs branch (see: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/db/derby/docs/branches/10.8/docs.properties?r1=1346010&r2=1346009&pathrev=1346010)

New Revision: 1404880

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1404880&view=rev
Log:
DERBY-5924 tasks for 10.8.3.

Change drdamaint version back to 1. Release target should not have changed it.

New Revision: 1405189

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1405189&view=rev
Log:
DERBY-5924 Tasks for 10.8.3 maintenance release

Bump 10.8 to 10.8.3.1 after making release candidate

Linking a few issues that were pain points in making the release candidate on Windows. Because of issues around creating release.properties I had to check in manually and then pause and revert the changes made by the target before letting it proceed. I like automation but am not a big fan of the release target checking things in without allowing a review even if the generation issues are fixed.

I also had an issue at the end related to the signatures. I could not determine good settings for md5.exe, md5.options and pgp.exe especially in the context of cygwin. I will attach the scripts I used for signing and ant.properties for the release.
Here is the ant.properties and script I used for building and signing the release with the IBM jvm's. Locations and mileage may vary.

Looks like one of the release publication steps got missed: the copying of the release html page which is needed to compensate for FOR-480. I have copied the 10.8.3.0.html page, added it to the website, and committed this change at subversion revision 845340.

Thanks Rick!
I started doing the same, but when I built the site I ended up with lots of changes - possibly line-ending diffs.
I think Kathey cannot work on doing the mavdn poms right now - I started on that too, but ran into some trouble there too and it will be a day or two before I can try again.

It looks to me as though the 10.8.3.0 download page was generated by running the following command from the trunk rather than from the 10.8 branch:

ant transformrelnotes

I have added a clarifying note to http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/ReleasePublication. Hopefully that will help prevent this from happening in the future.

Kristian noticed some broken link targets on the download page. I have corrected a couple link targets in the template used by the ReleaseNotesTransformer tool. See the derby-4855-06-aa-distributionLinks.diff patch attached to DERBY-4855.

I have re-generated the 10.8.3.0 download page and refreshed the website at subversion revision 1430312. I found that I had to do a second commit to actually commit the generated output. That was subversion revision 845499.

Let us know if you spot other problems with the download page.

Thanks,
-Rick

Attaching derby-5924-01-aa-removeSpuriousSpaces.diff. This patch fixes some typos in the distribution links on the 10.8.3.0 download page:

o Removes spurious spaces between the MD and the 5 on the bin.zip line.

o Removes spurious spaces in a closing </a> tag on the lib.zip line.

I don't know where these errors came from. I tried generating a 10.10.0.0 download page but nothing in my tool chain reproduced the errors. The ReleaseNotesTransformer tool does not appear to be the source of this problem. I can't pin the blame on Forrest either. Puzzling.

Touches the following files:

M src/documentation/content/xdocs/releases/release-10.8.3.0.html
M build/site/releases/release-10.8.3.0.html

Committed source change at subversion revision 1430345 and committed corresponding generated website change at subversion revision 845503.
Added the 10.8.3 insane JARs to the jars-directory for upgrade testing with revision 1433860.

I was unable to svn deploy because I did not correctly modify the maven 'settings.xml' file. Kristian did a trial run and it worked for him, so rather than try again, I released that staging (after verifying).
I am monitoring to see if the version shows up in the central maven repository (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/derby/).
updated the doap_Derby.rdf to reflect the 10.8.3.0 release with revision 1440086, see: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440086

tagged the release in svn, for code, with revision 1440098:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440098
for docs, with revision 1440099:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440099

Added 10.8.3.0 to org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.OldVersions in trunk with revision 1440129:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440129
Backported this to 10.9 branch with revision 1440142:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440142

I marked 10.8.3.0 as a Release in Jira. The ReleasePublication page also says I should merge older releases, but it looks like someone (Kathey, I assume) already wrapped up 10.8.2.3 into 10.8.3.0, probably in order to create the release notes...
The 10.8.3.0 has appeared on the maven repository.
Yes, I already merged 10.8.2.3 into 10.8.3.0 when I made the release notes.

I updated the STATUS file in trunk to reflect the 10.8.3.0 release with revision 1440586 (http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440586).
I backported this to 10.9 (revision 1440587: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440587) and 10.8 (revision 1440707:http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440707).
I noticed the 10.9 STATUS file does not have an entry for the 10.9.1.0 release; I trust this will be fixed if/when we make a 10.9.2 release.

I updated the News section in the website with the 10.8.3 release.
For some reason, this did not work in one go, I had to separately commit src/documentation/content/xdocs/index.xml (revision 1440732: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1440732), and build/site/index.html, which came with a different revision: 848684.
Do we need to update this last step in the ReleasePublication page? What is the correct process?
The link to the announcement has shown up on the apache db derby page, so I'm resolving this.

Hi Myrna,

I believe that there are 2 subversion repositories in play here:

1) The repository we've been using for the past 7 years to hold the website source. Let's call this the SOURCE repository.

2) The repository which holds the entire public website of Apache projects. Let's call this the ORG repository.

Before migrating to svnpubsub, the generated output of a website build ended up in another subtree of the SOURCE repository. All you had to do was commit the SOURCE changes and the generated changes would be committed too. Then you had to log onto people.apache.org in order to refresh the directory tree which was used to kick the rsync demon into publishing the changes.

After migrating to svnpubsub, the generated output of a website build ends up in a subtree of the ORG repository. So you have to checkin the SOURCE changes (the big commit stamp) and you have to checkin the ORG changes (the smaller commit stamp). You're right, we need to document this in the release instructions and in our instructions for updating the website. Thanks.
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.
